ygData.subject: Re: Talies is retired....
ygData.msgSnippet: At 22, I was dragged out to Lake Rathe by a guild bro of mine.  We went down the inlet between the barb village and the gypsies.  There is an aviak tower there
ygData.messageBody:
At 22, I was dragged out to Lake Rathe by a guild bro of mine. We went down
the inlet between the barb village and the gypsies. There is an aviak tower
there with two guards that are about lvl 19 or 20. If you can get back
there, you'll get suh-weeeeeeet experience up to about 24. At that point,
head over to Hermie's hut in SK. Stay there til 28, good money AND exp! (I
learned the fine art of Fear/Chain there heh!) I've found that if I can
find a good spot for blue cons to spawn, I can make MUCH MORE experience
than in any group.

Hope you reconsider,
-=B=-
-----Original Message-----
From: Kenneth E. Bachman <kbachman@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, October 29, 1999 8:51 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Talies is retired....


>From: "Kenneth E. Bachman" <kbachman@...>
>
>Talies the Wanderer wrote:
>
>> From: Talies the Wanderer <snicker@...>
>>
>> At 08:59 AM 10/29/99 -1000, you wrote:
>> >From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
>> >
>> >So does that mean you've quit playing EQ or you have retired from your
RL
>> >job? Not good if its #1, congrats if its #2.
>>
>> Actually, the first. It's unfortunate, but after spending the last 2
weeks
>> gaining a half a bubble slowly over several hours, only to lose it in an
>> instant at LEAST 6 times a day - I just got too frustrated. I was trying
>> to play by Brad's rules: group or die, so I was grouping, everywhere.
>
>...
>
>If you really can't stand it anymore, it's a shame, but I'll wish you well.
I would like to say,
>though, that level 22 was my WORST level by far. I died eight times (that
I can distinctly
>remember, probably more), for many of the reasons you cited. Three in one
miserable night, four
>in one utterly miserable night. Other people will have other solutions,
but the two things that
>helped me through it were High Keep basement (hehe) and getting into a
guild.
>
>You CAN'T fight in High Keep without a group (unless you are a very high
level KSer) because all
>the other players there won't stand for it (and you'll croak). You'll meet
a LOT of people, and
>you'll have the time to instruct them in proper play. (Some will get it,
some won't get it, but
>it's safe enough that you won't die anyway, so who cares? It's a good way
to make a list of
>competent players for later on. Plus, they love Bards.) Like I said, it's
a bubble every 2-3
>hours, depending on circumstances.
>
>Getting into a guild is a REALLY useful thing for those of you (like
myself) who can't play much
>and don't level as fast as their friends. I could probably get on tonight,
/guildsay Anyone want
>to help me get Lambent Vambrances? and get a positive response. (I won't
because I'm shooting
>for level 32.) Make sure the guild is big, and make sure it has a lot of
high levels (they
>didn't get there by playing stupidly).
>
>Kenross Cantoforjado, level 30 (still), Innoruuk
>
>>Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to toren@...
with the subject lol.
>
